value.title: Azure Fundamentals part 3: Describe core solutions and management tools on Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to choose the best services from Azure to build and manage cloud solutions.

topItems.title: Choose the best Azure IoT service for your application
topItems.excerpt: Examine Azure IoT services, and choose the right service for your scenario.

topItems.title: Choose the best AI service for your needs
topItems.excerpt: Examine Azure's AI services, and choose the right one for your company.

topItems.title: Choose the best Azure serverless technology for your compute scenario
topItems.excerpt: Examine Azure's serverless technologies and choose the right service for your scenario.

topItems.title: Choose the best tools to help organizations build better solutions
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Microsoft tools and services that help developers and operations engineers build modern solutions for the cloud and on-premises.

value.title: Core Cloud Services - Azure compute options
value.excerpt: Explore essential Azure concepts to find out how virtual machines, containers, and apps combined with serverless computing services can fortify your business.

value.title: Choose the best Azure serverless technology for your compute scenario
value.excerpt: Examine Azure's serverless technologies and choose the right service for your scenario.

value.title: AZ-400: Develop an instrumentation strategy
value.excerpt: Develop an effective instrumentation strategy through logging, telemetry, and monitoring and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging
topItems.excerpt: Learn about how to capture trace output from your Azure web apps. View a live log stream and download logs files for offline analysis.

topItems.title: Control and organize Azure resources with Azure Resource Manager
topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Resource Manager to organize resources, enforce standards, and protect critical assets from deletion.

topItems.title: Introduction to App Center
topItems.excerpt: Explore Azure App services to find ways to simplify creation and integration as you build, distribute, test, and analyze usage of yours apps.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Performance efficiency
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to adjust your capacity based on workload and how to optimize network performance, storage, and database performance.

value.title: AZ-400: Define and implement continuous integration
value.excerpt: Create automated pipelines that continuously build, test, and deploy your applications and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Create a build pipeline with Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Set up a continuous integration (CI) pipeline that automates the process of building your application.

topItems.title: Run quality tests in your build pipeline by using Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Find out about automated testing that proves your code to be maintainable, understandable, and functioning without repetitive manual testing.

topItems.title: Manage build dependencies with Azure Artifacts
topItems.excerpt: In this module, the Space Game web team guides you through creating a build pipeline that produces a package that can be used by multiple applications.

topItems.title: Host your own build agent in Azure Pipelines
topItems.excerpt: Work with guidance from the Space Game web team to set up your build agent running on-premises or on an Azure virtual machine running in the cloud.

value.title: Connect your services together
value.excerpt: Use Azure to create website front-ends, back-end services, and triggered functions that compute-on-demand and can also communicate with each other.

topItems.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure's storage queues, event hubs, event grid, and service bus can improve your communication between devices.

topItems.title: Implement message-based communication workflows with Azure Service Bus
topItems.excerpt: Discover how to write code in .NET applications using Azure Service Bus for communications that can handle high demand, low bandwidth, and hardware failures.

topItems.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
topItems.excerpt: Find out to use Azure Queue storage to handle high demand and improve resilience in your distributed applications.

topItems.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
topItems.excerpt: Learn to use Azure Event Hubs to reliably process high-volume data streams to enable you to code applications to send and receive messages through the hub.

value.title: Secure your cloud applications in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to secure your Azure apps and associated data with encryption, certificates, and policy.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Security
topItems.excerpt: Discover the tools that Azure provides to help you design a secure environment throughout your infrastructure, data, network, and applications.

topItems.title: Top 5 security items to consider before pushing to production
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the Site Reliability Engineering approach to the challenge of assuring reliability and gain a better understanding of why it matters.

topItems.title: Create security baselines
topItems.excerpt: Create security baselines

topItems.title: Manage secrets in your server apps with Azure Key Vault
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create an Azure Key Vault to store secret values and how to enable secure access to the vault.

value.title: Architect message brokering and serverless applications in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to create reliable messaging for your applications, and how to take advantage of serverless application services in Azure.

topItems.title: Create serverless logic with Azure Functions
topItems.excerpt: Azure Functions allow you to host business logic that can be executed without managing or provisioning server infrastructure

topItems.title: Route and process data automatically using Logic Apps
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to define a workflow to run your business with Logic apps using built-in triggers, actions, and conditional operators.

topItems.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services

topItems.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
topItems.excerpt: Find out to use Azure Queue storage to handle high demand and improve resilience in your distributed applications.

value.title: Manage security operations in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure security policies and manage security alerts with the tools and services in Azure.

topItems.title: Protect against security threats on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure can help you protect the workloads that you run both in the cloud and in your on-premises datacenter.

topItems.title: Create security baselines
topItems.excerpt: Create security baselines

topItems.title: Identify security threats with Azure Security Center
topItems.excerpt: Master securing your Azure workloads with Azure Security Center. In this module, you’ll discover how to detect and respond to threats with Azure Security Center.

topItems.title: Resolve security threats with Azure Security Center
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you’ll use the alert capabilities of Azure Security Center to watch for and respond to threats.

value.title: Architect API integration in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to architect API integration in Azure, and provide secure, scalable API access for your applications.

topItems.title: Publish and manage your APIs with Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Learn about using an Azure API gateway to share APIs with partners, and how to use subscription keys to control access to your APIs.

topItems.title: Improve the performance of an API by adding a caching policy in Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use Azure API Management to change an API without rewriting code to enable you to apply a caching policy to a GET operation for quicker response.

topItems.title: Protect your APIs on Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Protect your back-end APIs from information exposure and implement throttling to prevent resource exhaustion with policies in Azure API Management.

topItems.title: Control authentication for your APIs with Azure API Management
topItems.excerpt: Discover how to protect your APIs from unauthorized use with API keys and client certificate authentication.

value.title: AZ-400: Develop a security and compliance plan
value.excerpt: Build strategies around security and compliance and prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Secure your identities by using Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Active Directory to you secure your internal, external, and customer identities.

topItems.title: Create Azure users and groups in Azure Active Directory
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create Azure users and groups in Azure Active Directory.

topItems.title: Authenticate apps to Azure services by using service principals and managed identities for Azure resources
topItems.excerpt: Securely authenticate apps to Azure to manage and access Azure services. Service principals and managed identities give your app an Azure AD identity.

topItems.title: Configure and manage secrets in Azure Key Vault
topItems.excerpt: Configure and manage secrets in Azure Key Vault

value.title: Introduction to Azure IoT
value.excerpt: Follow this learning path for a broad and compelling introduction to the fundamentals of building IoT solutions with Azure IoT.

topItems.title: Enabling digital transformation
topItems.excerpt: Digital transformation is a wave of business innovation fueled by the explosion of technology—data, applications, and devices are everywhere. The cloud, artificial intelligence (AI), and the internet of things (IoT) give organizations new ways to make sense of information and generate insights to transform their business. Realizing the benefits of digital transformation requires business leaders to look beyond technology to reimagine existing business models and embrace a different way of bringing together people, data, and processes to create value for customers.

topItems.title: Microsoft Azure IoT strategy and solutions
topItems.excerpt: This module provides an overview of Azure IoT, and describes Microsoft tools, services, and infrastructure. This knowledge can help bring IoT to life for your organization and customers.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure IoT Hub
topItems.excerpt: University of Oxford

topItems.title: Learn how to manage IoT devices as an IT admin
topItems.excerpt: This module is an introduction to the Internet of Things for IT admins.

value.title: Build automated workflows to integrate data and apps with Azure Logic Apps
value.excerpt: This learning path guides you through creation of serverless workflows for your organization using Azure Logic Apps, a cloud service that automates your business processes.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Logic Apps
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to evaluate Logic Apps as an automation choice for your organization using criteria for integration, performance, conditionals, and connectors.

topItems.title: Route and process data automatically using Logic Apps
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to define a workflow to run your business with Logic apps using built-in triggers, actions, and conditional operators.

topItems.title: Call an API from a Logic Apps workflow using a custom connector
topItems.excerpt: In this module, learn to create a Logic Apps custom connector to call an API from a Logic Apps workflow.

topItems.title: Create and deploy Logic Apps using Azure Resource Manager templates
topItems.excerpt: Define a Logic Apps workflow declaratively as a Resource Manager template and deploy the app using the Azure Command Line Interface (CLI).

value.title: Build mixed reality digital twins with Azure Digital Twins and Unity
value.excerpt: Learn how to create a mixed reality HoloLens 2 application using Azure Digital Twins and Unity, a real-time 3D platform.

topItems.title: Set up a mixed reality project for Azure Digital Twins in Unity
topItems.excerpt: Get step-by-step guidance on how to set up and configure a mixed reality project in Unity for HoloLens 2. Learn about the Azure Digital Twins and SignalR services and common use cases for the Azure platform in Mixed Reality.

topItems.title: Build a 3D Scene for mixed reality in Unity
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create a 3D Scene in Unity using the Microsoft Maps SDK or static terrain. Get familiar with mixed reality scene design, the Unity interface, and deploying your Unity project to a HoloLens 2.

topItems.title: Configure 3D assets for mixed reality in Unity
topItems.excerpt: Get step-by-step instructions on how to place Prefab 3D assets and models into a Unity scene. Learn about Unity Scriptable Objects and mixed reality design considerations before deploying to a HoloLens 2.

topItems.title: Connect IoT data to HoloLens 2 with Azure Digital Twin and Unity
topItems.excerpt: Stream simulated operational telemetry data from physical assets to Azure Digital Twin and visualize data in Unity and the HoloLens.

value.title: Develop with Azure Digital Twins
value.excerpt: Azure Digital Twins is the new wave of innovation that helps unlock advanced scenarios in IoT and beyond, enabling you to evolve from connected assets to connected environments. It is used to help you create digital replicas (models) of entire environments. These environments could be buildings, factories, farms, energy networks, railways, stadiums, wearables, smart spaces, hospitals, hotels, schools, stores, warehouses, fleet, and more—even entire cities! By completing the learning path you will have good understanding of how to model any environment, and bring digital twins to life in a scalable and secure manner, connect assets such as IoT devices and existing business systems, use a robust event system to build dynamic business logic and data processing, APIs, SDKs, and integrate with Azure data, analytics, and AI, Time Series Insights services using Event Hubs, Event Grids, Azure Functions and visualize the DTDL model using Digital Twin Explorer to help you track the past and then predict the future.

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Digital Twins
topItems.excerpt: This module provides an overview of Azure Digital Twins and describes Microsoft tools, services, and infrastructure. This knowledge can help bring digital twins to life for your organization and customers.

topItems.title: Build an Azure Digital Twins graph for a chocolate factory production line
topItems.excerpt: This module covers the first steps in building an Azure Digital Twins solution. The units cover making an instance of Azure Digital Twins, and learning about, creating, and visualizing, DTDL models. You will create, validate, graph, and query, models for a chocolate factory production line.

topItems.title: Ingest Data into Azure Digital Twins
topItems.excerpt: Learn the different ways to ingest data into Azure Digital Twins.

topItems.title: Output from Azure Digital Twins to downstream services
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about how Azure Digital Twins uses event routes to send data to consumers outside the service.

value.title: Java on Azure
value.excerpt: Start here and learn how you can build, migrate and scale Java applications on Azure leveraging Azure services, and using tools and frameworks that you know and love – Spring, Tomcat, WildFly, JBoss, WebLogic, WebSphere, Maven, Gradle, IntelliJ, Eclipse, Jenkins, Terraform etc.

topItems.title: Introduction to Java on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Goal of this module is to welcome you as Java Developers on Azure. In this module, you'll begin to discover the opportunities for Java developers on Azure.

topItems.title: Choose an Azure service for deploying your Java application
topItems.excerpt: In this tutorial, you'll learn about running your Java applications on Azure, and choose the best option between Virtual Machines, Azure App Services, Serverless functions, Kubernetes and Azure Spring Cloud.

topItems.title: Create and deploy a data-driven Spring Boot Java application to Azure App Service with Spring Initializr and Maven
topItems.excerpt: Create a Spring Boot application, connect it to a MySQL database and then deploy to Azure App Service.

topItems.title: Deploy a Java web app to Azure
topItems.excerpt: You'll learn how to create a Java web application and deploy it to Azure App Service.

value.title: Securely connect IoT devices to the cloud
value.excerpt: Follow this learning path to learn how to securely connect IoT devices with Azure IoT.

topItems.title: Learn how to manage IoT devices as an IT admin
topItems.excerpt: This module is an introduction to the Internet of Things for IT admins.

topItems.title: Automatically provision IoT devices securely and at scale with the Device Provisioning Service
topItems.excerpt: The focus of this module is on creating a Device Provisioning Service (DPS) to securely handle multiple remote devices. First, you create an IoT Hub, and add the DPS service. Next, an X.509 root certificate, and multiple leaf certificates, are created to handle security. Code for a simulated device is provided. You then link all the pieces together, and verify that your DPS resource works. After completing the module, you should have a good understanding of how to provision Azure IoT devices at scale.

topItems.title: Identify anomalies by routing data via IoT Hub to a built-in ML model in Azure Stream Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Learn about Azure IoT Hub message routing, and Stream Analytics anomaly detection. Start by creating an app that simulates issues with conveyor belt vibration. Then, use the Azure portal to route all the data for archiving in blob storage. Finish by routing the vibration data to anomaly detection, using a built-in ML model.

topItems.title: Remotely monitor and control devices with Azure IoT Hub
topItems.excerpt: Create an IoT Hub device app, and a back-end service app. As a scenario, we use the monitoring, and controlling, of the temperature and humidity of a cheese cave.

value.title: How to get started with Azure API Management | Azure Tips and Tricks
value.excerpt: In this edition of Azure Tips and Tricks, learn how to get started with Azure API Management, a service that helps protect and manage your APIs.   For more tips and tricks, visit: http://azuredev.tips     Get started with 12 months of free services and $200 USD in credit. Create your free account today

value.title: An overview of Azure Integration Services | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Azure Integration Services brings together API Management, Logic Apps, Service Bus, and Event Grid as a reliable, scalable platform for integrating on-premises and cloud-based applications, data, and processes across your enterprise. [04:41] Demo Start   Azure Integration Services overview https://aka.ms/azfr/527/01

value.excerpt: Bahram Banisadr introduces Scott Hanselman to Azure Event Grid, which is a fully-managed event service for managing events across many different Azure services and applications. Made for performance and scale, it simplifies building event-driven applications and serverless architectures.   Azure Event
